title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 March 2016 - XWiki
content: has quit 00:20  has joined #xwiki 00:23  has quit 00:23  has joined #xwiki 00:26  has quit 00:33  has quit 00:37  has quit 00:37  has quit 01:06  has joined #xwiki 01:12  has quit 01:24  has joined #xwiki 02:16  has quit 02:53  has joined #xwiki 02:54  has quit 06:19  has joined #xwiki 06:28  has quit 06:32  has joined #xwiki 07:52  has joined #xwiki 08:02  has quit 08:05  has joined #xwiki 08:23  has quit 08:23  has joined #xwiki 08:33  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 09:38  has quit 09:38  has joined #xwiki 09:40  has joined #xwiki 10:03  has joined #xwiki 10:04  has joined #xwiki 10:17  has joined #xwiki 10:31  has joined #xwiki 10:37  has joined #xwiki 10:38  has quit 10:40  has joined #xwiki 10:57  has joined #xwiki 10:58  Good morning folks, we were talking about the possibility to add in-place editing to XWiki, we might be able to do it incrementally if we had hidden spans on each view-mode displayer which displays an object property. 10:59  I'd love in place editing, but first it means a new edit UI so that the panels don't change. JV had some designs done for that BTW. 11:00  So the question is, theoretically speaking would a patch adding a hidden span "marker" to each $doc.display('view') output be something likely to be merged ? 11:00  M-cjd: any backward compat issue for anyone having a custom skin? 11:01  on the principle I don't thin it's a problem, we just need to be careful that it doesn't break too many stuff 11:02  My feeling is probably no because we're adding a 11:02  switching to IRC because matrix is mega-laggy 11:03  probably class="xwiki-object-marker" but while trying not to write too much trash over the wire in the HTML file 11:03  then probably another 11:04  idea being we can take the elements between object-marker and object-marker-end and replace them with the js editable displayer 11:49  has joined #xwiki 12:35  has joined #xwiki 13:46  Hi here, does it still make sense to fail the build of a XAR for a missing parent after XWiki 7.4.2? 13:47  Because I understood 'parent' was deprecated 13:47  but maybe I understood incorrectly... 13:47  woshilapin: hi 13:48  we discussed this 13:48  ha 13:48  and we said that for FTM yes we want to continue doing this since parent is deprecated but not removed 13:48  ok 13:48  but indeed we need to decide till when we want tod othis 13:50  thanks 14:13  yep at some point we will need to remove that check, we could also make it optional and enable it only in platform 14:13  (so that it's not enabled for contribs have 8.x parent) 14:48  I feel we should have platform and contrib in sync on this topic. I think I'd keep it till end of 8.x cycle. Now we could certainly prepare and have an option to turn off that check in the XAR plugin (but it would be on by default) 14:48  anyway, we should discuss this on the list 14:53  has quit 14:53  has joined #xwiki 15:00  has joined #xwiki 15:01  has quit 15:06  has joined #xwiki 15:07  has quit 15:27  has quit 15:55  anyone against https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8919 ? 15:55  evalica: ? 15:56  vmassol: you can add it if you consider to be a consistency improvement. Is good that we have the AppBar configuration in Administration and users can remove entries. 15:56  now, what about the Quick Links panel? do you plan to remove it? 15:57  one functionality that is has is the Ctrl + G mention for the Jump. 15:57  evalica: I see that manuel has removed it in this PR 15:57  I've just commented on it 15:57  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/pull/68/files 15:58  indeed there's the ctrl+g thing but it's never been the right place for it IMO, we need to find a better location 15:58  has joined #xwiki 15:58  could be a tip panel 15:58  with one tip to start with 15:59  (I'm sure we can easily come up with 2-3 tips) 15:59  (displayed at random) 15:59  that would fix the issue I raised in my comment too 16:06  evalica: 16:06  wdyt? 16:06  vmassol: there is an older proposal that has a Tips & Tricks panel http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Improvements/Skin4x/appWithinMinutesDesktopSnapshot.png 16:06  yep 16:06  we can start simpler without the ui to navigate through tips 16:07  I'd put that tip panel as part of the help app 16:07  another tip could be a link to XWikiSyntax 16:07  or Getting Started from xwiki.org 16:07  sounds good, we already have 3 tips 16:07  :) 16:07  :) 16:08  creating jira and sending proposal 16:11  thanks 16:14  done 16:32  guys, would be nice to have your opinion on the "Display of documents in AllDocs LT in multilingual mode" thread. At least to agree if solution 4 is what we wznt 16:32  \*want 16:32  mflorea: maybe you could also have a look at the mail since you know the topic already 16:33  I'll check 16:33  thx 16:35  btw we're 3 working days away from the 8.1M1 release 16:35  Enygma`: we need to start converging on the CI 16:36  since I know you're busy, I can check it out if you want 16:37  btw last time platform build was successful was the 4th of March… ie 25 days ago… glurps… 16:40  has quit 16:41  has joined #xwiki 16:53  has quit 16:53  has joined #xwiki 16:58  3 working days means we deploy on Friday? 17:00  has joined #xwiki 17:02  Monday 17:04  vmassol: will start focusing on the release 17:12  has quit 17:24  has joined #xwiki 17:57  ah yes good point tmortagne with plain/1.0 17:57  :) 17:58  we have plenty of Translations.xml to fi 17:58  \*fix 17:58  vmassol: I see we still seems to have lots of translation document in xwiki syntax, we should probably ad that to the xar;format 17:58  \*xar:format 17:58  yes that would be easy, good idea 17:58  to xar:check and xar:format 17:59  yep 17:59  you create the jira? 18:09  tmortagne: ? 18:13  vmassol: as you want, I would gladly let you do it if you have the time :) 18:14  has quit 18:22  tmortagne: doing it 18:23  has quit 18:23  has joined #xwiki 18:28  has joined #xwiki 18:45  tmortagne: when we export translations from l10n the xml files will have the wrong syntax I guess 18:45  do you think you could fix this? 18:52  vmassol: l10n reuse default language XML no nothing to fix on this side 18:52  s/no/so/ 18:52  ok cool
